verses.roman:
pādyam ācamanīyaṁ ca
gandhaṁ sumanaso 'kṣatān
dhūpa-dīpopahāryāṇi
dadyān me śraddhayārcakaḥ

synonyms: pādyam—water for washing the feet; ācamanīyam—water for washing the mouth; ca—and; gandham—fragrances; sumanasaḥ—flowers; akṣatān—unbroken grains; dhūpa—incense; dīpa—lamps; upahāryāṇi—such items of paraphernalia; dadyāt—he should present; me—to Me; śraddhayā—with faith; arcakaḥ—the worshiper.
translation: The worshiper should faithfully present Me with water for washing My feet and mouth, fragrant oils, flowers and unbroken grains, along with incense, lamps and other offerings.
